text: Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours cloudy and copper with no head. The aroma is a fruity and earthy intermingling of sour cherries, damp basement and recently felled oak. Full-bodied with tickling carbonation. The flavor is as sour as Hell, and fruity, with a light sour-cherry component and a rumor of red wine vinegar. Tart, semi-dry finish. Kudos to the South Florida Brew Crew for sharing this world-class beer!
Bottle shared at Jasons. RIch dark cherry sour and lightly acidic brown that is just spot on and tasty.

Bottle from spacecoyote (cheers Carl!) and foolishly consumed alone at home. This is one fantastic Flanders Red. Its acidic and sour, but the oak barrel aging rounds the sharpness out nicely, leaving the beer balanced, funky, tart, and complex. Lots of flavor of sour cherries and fruit, mixed with funky barnyard and acidity. Knockout beer that lives up the hype.

Bottle shared, pours ruby brown with small white head. Aromas and flavor are ultra sour and acidic cherry, wood, red grape skins, oak, vitamins, cranberry, and sour candy. Light to medium body with salivating tartness. Another great beer from SARA.
Chestnut body with a quarter inch of beige head. Funky, sour, brown bread, cherry, vanilla. Definitely Flanders style. A blend of sweet and sour. Mild to medium acetic character. Tasty.
Bottle. Clear dark Amber pour with a white head. Tart berry highlights with caramel malt backbeats. Vinegar backbeats. A bit thin and one dimensional. Average body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Deep amber body. Small khaki head. Nose is oak, dark fruits, cherry, strong yeast and some caramel malt. Taste is strong sour cherry. Oak. Almost vinegary with the sourness. Vanilla and a very light caramel malt in the back end. Medium light. Really sour. Well carbonated. Very nice.

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is clear brown with a small tan head and decent lacing. Brown sugar, toffee, red wine vinegar, oaky, lightly spicy, some pepper, and caramel in the aroma. Taste is sour malty, bready, brown sugar, acidic, some oak, pepper, and grapey with a big sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Not bad.

Bottle @ home, thanks to Steve_0. Pours a red orange appearance with a thin brown head. Aroma has plenty of oak, some leather, caramel, vanilla, and spicy fruit. Nice mouthfeel. Low sweetness and bitterness. Soft acetic flavor with nice tannic oak notes. Drinks pretty good but not my favorite.

Poured from a bottle. 
Aroma is nice and fruity with good berry, cherry, plum and prune notes. Some medium light oak notes. Nice malt notes of toasted bread, caramel and fainter toffee and hints of treacle. Some light leather notes. 
Pours a brown color with a bit of a burnt amber hue and a small, moderately thick, dark tan head that recedes fairly quickly. Faint lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with light caramel and faint toffee and toasted bread. Moderate fruit notes with dark cherry and berry being most prevalent, but also some plums. Light oak notes and red wine tannins. A bit of a leather note from the malt. Medium light bitterness and faint alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringnecy and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this is a really amazing Flanders style beer from the US. Really nice fruit notes and complimentary malt and barrel character. A great beer.

Bottle at the RBSG, grand tasting in Portland 
Clear brown with a medium sized beige head, good lacing. Aroma is tart, woody and leather. Flavors are tart, cherries, woody and leather  
Nice

750mL bottle, pours a deep dark amber brown with a small white head. Aroma brings out dark vinegar, leather, and oak. Flavour is quite vinegary, with light wood and thin sir fruitiness. Not very convincing. Too much vinegar and a thin palate. Overrated.
Bottle - Soured dark malts with some nice wood and light cherry notes. Clear mahogany with a decent beige head. Nice soured dark malts, cherry notes. Nice.
Bottle. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. A big fruity sour woody nose. The flavor is big sweet malts, toffee, caramel, red sour. Berry. Lovely.

Bottle at RBSG Grand Tasting. Pours a hazy copper brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong cherry skin, oak, leather. Thin mouth, oak tannin, cherries, leather, tart finish, very nice.

750ml bottle pours out amber cola color with some small ring of a head. Nose is great fruity notes some ripe berries tartness wood and funk. Taste is more of the nice fruit vanilla barrel and berries.
Bottle. Ruby brown pour with tan head. Tart fruit, sour funk aromas. Herbal, sour tart and funky berry flavors, some dark roasted and fruit like malt tones.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Bottle. Rating 10,500. Pours dark brown white head. Nose and taste of sour cherry, sour caramel, earth and chocolate / medium body

Pours a burnt umber with ruby edges and a finger of eggshell foam. Lots of earthy berry, dusty wood, tart foggy basement funk, leather, roasted grain, cola and a glimpse of cinnamon poking through on the backend. Yummy dark sour with great balance of roast and acidity. Dry finish !

750ml bottle pours hazy dark reddish brown with medium head. Nose is earthy dark tart cherry fruit, light cola, soft funk, oak, vanilla cherry, berries. Taste is Flanders-driven but also combines a soft minerally dusty funk found in many Sante offerings. Light sweetness. Finishes tart low acidity, some musty mashed cherry and earthy wet wood, cola, leather. Great.

Pour is a golden rimmed cola brown with a thin ring of off white head. Nose is a delicate, but every bit a Flanders. Toasty malts, malt vinegar, Apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, vanilla, and a metallic undertone. Thinner palate for a Flanders, which is awesome in my opinion. Rounded and smooth, but with a acrid acetic acid tinge. Taste is all the same as the nose. More refined than most flanders. Great for the style, but not my thing.

Bottle @ home, thanks Greg. Mahogany pour with a small khaki head. Nice raisin and cherry fruitiness. Pleasant red wine, leather, and balsamic acidity. Pretty solid aroma. Flavor is good and tangy. Fruit leather, balsamic, and a lot of dark fruits. Tangy vinegar, some oak, and a bit of lemon zest. Slight savory note on the tongue. Really well done.

Bottle. Pours hazy reddish hazel, small beige head, decent lacing. Aroma is oaky, cherry, light barnyard funkiness, some toffee, perhaps a note of vanilla. Flavor is medium tart, lightly funky with the "normal" SARA funky bugs, lots of oakiness, lightly vinous with cherry/raspberry notes and a bit of a floral quality. Medium body. Solid Flanders red.
Bottle shared with bytemesis. Dark cherry brown. Sour brown notes in the nose, light funk. Dry, tart, woody at first then nutty.
Reddishh pour, tan head. Perfectly sour and juicy, hints of cherries, balsamic, barnyard funk dances around. Some light bready flavors are a perfect balance. Delicious.
Pours mahogany with a light tan head. Big woody malty aroma, firm caramel with cherry cola accents. Flavor follows, really acidic but with such a fulfilling palate. Delicious.
